content: I'm good, thanks. I had a bit of a crazy morning. Had to rush to finish some grading and then meet some colleagues for some breakfast. You?
Sounds like you're getting into that. Project-wise, I hear you got some feedback on it from your colleagues?
That's okay, got a few minutes, right? So, project-wise, what were you doing this morning?
i go out of bed, drink coffee
Coffee sounds like just what you need in the morning...
I'm sure it helps get you going. You're quite the early riser, aren't you? Did you have some breakfast too?
That's great, a nice, simple breakfast. What's your favorite Mexican breakfast food, if you don't mind me asking?
(laughs) Ah, that's nice, Enrique! I think the craic is all about food around these parts, don't you?
(laughs) I can imagine, huh? We're actually having Sunday roast at my place this weekend. Irish roasts, just like nonna used to make. What about your nonna, do you have one?
Nonna, she was a saint, right? Older and wise, always whipping up the best Romanesco. What's your nonna's cook like, if I may ask, Enrique?

Nonna was a firecracker, that's for sure. I'm a bit of a taste-tester when it comes to her cook, or should I say, her cook-testing. (laughs) Her one rule's you have to try it, all of it, including the bones and the marrow and the gravy.
Thanks, you're a good friend for understanding. I'm glad you're a nice sort of person, Enrique.
